intro: Massonia greenii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Massonia greenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
